comments.text: Great spot, got a ride with the first person to Basel. Enjoy the hitchhiking!
good toward zurich, waited 5 min
From Bern: Take the S8 to Zollikhofen, then follow the Länggasse. Turn left before the motorway.

!!! pay attention, right now there's some construction work. all cars have to cross the bridge and get to fuel/food over there, so it's quite difficult righjt now, but shut be good, when they're finished...
I got a car straight to Zürich after about 30min asking around (not at the gas station, but at the picknick area) - Sept. 2013.
Got a ride in 30s to Basel!

Gas station Deitingen

Great towards ZÃ¼rich/Basel, opposite direction propably as well.
Really good spot to go to Lausanne or Bern. Got a ride to Bern in December 2025 around 10am
Got a lift to Geneva before I even reached the spot. Two guys saw my sign and called me over.

The Petrol Station is a good spot to ask people for a ride, or the entrance of the shopping center/McDonalds. Good to speak some german as almost all those who go towards Bern/Zurich/Basel speak swiss-german.
Big and Busy Petrol Station on the highway. Cars who stop here go both sides: towards Lausanne/Geneva/Italy/France or Bern/Basel/Zurich
Nice spot especially for Zürich! Not many cars here but most are going through Zürich. We also talked to some going to Luzern, but we needed to go to Zürich. Waited 5 min.

TO ZURICH

This is only a parking lot but you might still get a lift. Unbelievable but true. I hitched there often and always found somebody who gave me a lift. There is no motorway gasstation nearby so therefore many cars make a quick stop for the toilet. free toilet too.... and breathtaking view.

Amazing spot, picked up immidiately by some Liechtensteiners. Unfortunately this great spot was wasted on a crappy ride, We wanted to go to Zug/Lucerne and they were headed to Zürich so they only drove us like 5 minutes down the highway before dropping us off at a worse spot. They were kinda hippies and I think they just wanted to pick us up cause they thought it would be fun. Word of advice: if it’s not the ride it’s not the ride, and don’t trust Liechtensteiners they’re a bit strange

Very active service station. Had no trouble finding a ride standing at the exit. In 10 minutes I was offered 2 rides to Zurich but I declined and the 3rd few minutes after took me past Bern. Probably possible to find rides to Lausanne and Geneva if you're lucky.

Immediately as we got out of a car, another one pulled over asking if we need a ride. :)) The shortest waiting time ever. :))

But generally it should be a good gas station to go north to Zurich and further. On the map is says you can even cross from one side to another, but I can't confirm that.
Hitched a ride to Hard with  “Bregenz” on a sign on a Saturday afternoon.
Good spot with space to pull over and cars are slow after the roundabout. I had a sign for "Kreuzlingen/Konstanz"
Good spot to hike to Kandersteg (Scout Centre). Always (over 5 times) pick-up within a few minutes. Only downside is there is not a lot of space for drivers to stop.
Heading to Kandersteg, having a scout uniform helped, since I was going to KISC (Kandersteg International scout centre)
Good amount of cars stopping, there should be no problem finding a ride if you speak to enough people. Look to get a ride past Zurich in order not to get stuck around the city.
I was here several times. And every time it toocks less then an hour to get picked up!!
ische ische sehr gut
Josef here again 👋🏼 amazing spot going Spiez/Interlaken/Kandersteg
Pretty nice spot, got a local to get me to Spiez, a short ride, no sign, plenty of space for car to stop
Good spot for rides to Bern or Basel. Also good for local destinations.
Very easy to get a ride. The only way out of the valley is to north. Just wait for the car train to come, and there's tens of cars in line to go your direction.
Saturday, 13:45, 2 People + Dog
Saturday, 13:45, 2 People + Dog, works really fast
Stoplight with right only turning lane. all cars go to the next village or satigny, where the train station is.
We took a lift to Täsch and were very lucky to get picked up so fast
Nice spot to hitch with a car through the tunnel to Wallis. We went through the train station and just came to the spot where all the cars are waiting for the green light to enter the train.
Not much space to pull over, still no problem getting towards Saignelégier. Very friendly locals for hitchhiking in the whole region, both french and swiss part :)

You'll get picked up towards Porrentruy in a matter of seconds, if you wait a few cars it's easy to get to get to Delémont as well. As everywhere in the region, a lot of traffic in the morning from French people working in Switzerland.

Great place towards Pontarlier. Preferably wait for a ride to France and not Le Locle, from then on its not difficult. Enough space to pull over, this spot seems much better than everything I've seen while walking from the train station.
Got a ride to go on a gas station north of Zurich. Thanks Karine
Shady and lots of traffic heading east
Easy to get closer to Lausanne and 9 highway

Got a ride instantly, straight to Renens. A lot of people live in france (its cheaper) and go to switzerland for work, so in the morning theres a lot of traffic, some to geneve and some to lausanne, maybe even further.
a lot of space to stop, probably not very legal. We got lucky and got a ride to Zurich
We stood near th fruit stand. Great visibility, good spot for direction of Austria or Germany
perfect spot. we waited 3 minutes to get to belfort
Stayed at the bus stop under the highway. Very short wait! A lot of traffic going to the highway
Waited only 10min and got a ride from a family. Even the other driver passing by were very nice. Good spot, plenty of cars passing by
Nice spot to go in the direction of Bern, Bienne, Basel, Zurich
Good place for hitchhiking to Zürich. Cars go slowly, there is enough place to stop.

There’s an emergency lane and a lot of space for cars to stop. Even it’s a non-pedestrian zone I didn’t had problems when the police passed by. It’s the best place to go south (Lausanne, Geneve, Montreux).

I stood with a sign that said Geneva and in 10 min. I’ve got a ride to Lausanne.
There are two zebra crossings so the cars drive slowly and a place for them to pull in right after the second crossing.
Great space for cars to stop. Supermarket nearby. Good for Zürich/Basel
First-rate spot for a ride to Bellinzona.
Good spot to go onto the highway. A bit of space to pull over and a good amount of traffic. Good to have a sign either direction Neuchâtel, Bern or Lausanne
Lots of space to pull over, main road into the direction of vallorbe

Direction Bellegarde and Lyon. Not too much traffic but it's a good spot to get out of Geneva as it is easily reachable by bus and go towards Collonges, where there is the main road with much more traffic.

If you want to go by the car train up the hill than you need to stop a car (no pedestrians allowed). The train rides between 20 minutes to an hour (google it). What is nice - you don’t have to pay for the passangers inside the car, just for the car itself (so it’s free for you) :)

Large service station towards Lausanne and Geneva. Best is to stand on the exact marked spot with a sign, just in front of the gas station. Cars leaving the parking lot will pass by and whenever there are people filling up gas you can quickly go ask them.
Direction La Cure and France
Direction St-Cergue and France. Good visibility and enough space to stop. Difficult to get here from Nyon Center, but if you get dropped off the highway it's easy
Space to pull over at the bus stop, easy to get further down the lake or direction valaid

Very good spot to get far rides, because all the tourists from chateau de gruyère pass here. Nice place to stop for cars, but they can't see you from very far. Still, they are going slow and have reasonable time to pull over. We got lucky with a direct ride to geneva.
Not too much space to stop for cars, but still a good spot to get to Fribourg
Good place. A lot of people going to Lucern, Zurich. I needed to Bern and found after 30 minutes
Got a ride to Furkapass within a few minutes.
Small gravel pull out for a car to stop. Held a sign for “martigny” lots of cars going by

A great spot with lots of traffic. Drivers can stop at the petrol station and the small jams at the round-about allowes direct communication. We used the spot during the 10th Swiss Hitchhiking Championship and got a ride to Bulle.

The large shopping center (a new one just opened its doors as we stopped here) may bring some local traffic to this spot, which may be a plus for medium distances.
Excellent place with many cars and enough space for the drivers to stop and load luggage. We used it on a Saturday (around 3 p.m.) for the 10th Swiss Hitchhiking Championship on our way to Annecy.

The best spot to get a ride further south. At the very end of the tunnel is an (emergency) rest stop, which is pretty close to the roundabout. The cars slow down and often stack on this roundabout so ther have enough time to see you.
I was heading for the spot near the highway, hitchiked while walking and got a ride to Thun
Enough space for a car to stop. Worked surprisingly well for going to Davos

official hitch hiking point/Gantrisch "Mitfahrpunkte" near the Schwarzenburg train station
https://www.gantrisch.ch/anreise/mitfahrpunkte/

afternoon, trains weren't working anymore (accident) and there are no buses in direction to Bern, so I hitch hiked. I found a place were cars could stop right after and the second car stopped immediately. They left me at the first bus stop in Köniz, (the person wasn't going to Bern)
Good spot to go to Winterthur direction
Since it was chaotic up there at the parking lot and we were tired to ask, we chose this spot to go with a Chur sign. Got a ride eventually to Ilanz.
Great spot to go to Andermatt. A lot of traffic during weekend or holidays when there are big traffic jams in the tunnel, so a lot of cars are deciding to go through the pass instead.
there is a parking spot (for maybe 7 cars) September-thursday 1pm
Nice spot, we (m/w) didn't wait long with a Zurich sign, a guy took us to a gas station just before Zurich. Cars are slow on the rest area.
A guy dropped us here (m/w), there's space to stop. We waited 15min with a Zurich sign. A guy with a Tesla SUV took us to Kriegstetten
Fast road, difficult to stop quickly

You can hitch up the Mountain only 40 minutes every 2 hours, then it's closed for 20 minutes, and then traffic goes the other way around for 40 minutes. Make sure to inform yourself about the hours and time your start.
This is a good spot for going up the mountain.
Enough place for the cars to stop, enough traffic. Good spot to go to North.

I was just trying to get to Schaffhausen as I wanted to sleep. It took me 5 minutes to get that ride. Very good spot as cars are slow after the border and in the dark you can stand in the light from the reststop and easily be seen.
No problems with the police, despite being extremely close to the zoll; many slow cars

I came there walking but the police said that I couldn't do hitchhiking there, so I went to the roundabout and started to hitchhike there. The gate separating the Rastplatz Tägermoss Ost and the street is always unlocked, so you can get there and leave whenever you want
nice spot under a roof if it is rainy...
Started here on a tuesday at about 10:30 am. After about 15 min some lady agreed to take us to a station on the way. Well she even changed here route and took us one motorway gas station further :)
Not many cars but I got a ride to Olten after 20 minutes.
Got picked while eating my sandwich with my sign saying Bern next to me. Didn't have the time to finish my sandwich.
Small service station but I didn't have to wait long.
Service station on the way to Bern, Zurich and Basel.
Illegal for drivers to stop but relatively safe, take the cycling path below the roundabouts to access it otherwise dangerous

There is a bus stop on the right side of the road, just before the roundabout where the A9 highway entry towards Montreux/Lausanne/Geneva is. I waited about 2 minutes and was picked up by a car that drove me all the way to Morges!
Good spot. Be careful! You have to go over 2 fences to get there and one of them is electrified! I got hurt pretty badly and my muscles were hurt for next 3 days. But got a ride to Lausanne
Good spot to Lausanne (I rode from Bern, somebody picked me off here), waited 10 minutes and got straight ride to Lausanne, many many cars going.
Got a few people offering to take me short distance waited it out with a sign to Geneva and got a ride all the way.

Sur le parking, demandez Ã  aller vers Lausanne, GenÃ¨ve ou Berne (utilisez les plaques d'immatriculation). Vous Ã©viterez ainsi l'agglomÃ©ration de Lausanne si vous allez plus loin.
In the parking area, ask to get to Lausanne, Geneva or Bern (use the cars' licence plates), so you can avoid Lausanne's center if you're going further.
Good way to get out of Chur, even though there is a lot of local traffic. Its best to ask people directly. Managed to get a ride in 20 mins to a big rastplatz before Sargans.
Bus is number 3, the place is good

TO ZURICH

Bus 12 (pls doublecheck) to Haldenstein. You will get dropped left of the roundabout. Cross and walk towards to gas station. You can either stand with a sign or ask people at the gas station.
Good to go direction Furka or Nufenen, the spot is located on a bend but cars have plenty of place to stop. And you have a distant view of oncoming cars
Good spot for direction Luzern, Furkapass.
Legendary spot. Tons of cars going everywhere
Took out my sign and someone directly took me to Bern
As an exit dweller I don't like this place. There is to much going on with weird driving routes around the place. But you can't argue results. I was gone to Basel in 23mins, so I must rate 5 stars.
Need to wait a bit but accessible by train and walk
Kinda awkward/fun with the slow traffic speed, but very effective. Got a ride towards Bern (got out earlier to head towards Biel)
Worked pretty well asking around, got a ride in some 30min to Lausanne but the guy was going to Geneva.

It is very good spot on working days to go direction to Geneva or Lausanne. However on Saturday I was waiting for 3 hours any car to this direction and it never came. 4 cars stoped for me and were ready to take me to the mountains, but I skipped it hoping to get direct ar to Geneva. Then two guys approached me and offered a ride to Mont Blanc and I couldn't resist :)
Very good to go to lausanne a geneve
It's a bit more difficult to hike South, but possible
Directly asked people at the coop  and first request it worked
Good spot for Direction Zürich / Bern.

hard to believe but maybe this is a great spot. no space to pull over rlly but cars stop for the red light so you have some time to charm them with your great sign and pretty smiles.
fair amount of traffic and ppl were really friendly - we even got handed a wedge of cheese from a guy waiting at the red light because he was so excited to see hitchhikers.
I've hitched here LOTS of times, and even though the place looks pretty shitty, I've almost never waited longer than maybe 20 minutes.
A possible spot for hitching towards Zurich and Berne - not a whole lot of space to pull over, though.

Came back to this spot again, and had my doubts if I was just lucky the first time, but yet again soon I managed to get a ride to Lausanne. Probably not the best spot in the world but it gets the job done.
Really great spot for hitchhiking towards Lausanne. With a Lausanne sign, got a lift in 5 minutes to Châtel-Saint-Denis and from there it was an easy hitch to Lausanne.
I think it's a good place to go to Fribourg, Lausanne etc. There is enough place for drivers to stop, traffic light, relatively slow motion...
Really good spot to get to Zurich or Bern
Walked up to this spot from the centre and seems like the best way to get to Zürich... A lot of traffic going this direction
There is a bus stop here that cars going towards Zürich will pass.
Really good spot to go to Winterthur or Zürich, the cars can pull over easily and they don't come too fast because of the traffic lights. I (male) was alone.

For a town this size and this type of on ramp there was a decent amount of traffic, there is a really good spot for cars to safely pull over to pick you up. The construction mentioned by others is definitely finished.
Parking place visible on satellites isn't there anymore since place is under construction. Hitchability depends on state of construction.
Towards Zürich. There is a parking place here a little before the entrance to the motorway.

Also great in the other direction, lots of space to stop and many people stop to take photos, you can ask them. Also, worth to stop yourself and have a look, great views and possible to do a little walk. One of my favourite lunch places while on the road

Lot of space for cars to stop, fresh mountain air :)
I took ride to Chaminix-Mont-Blanc

Perfect if you want to go east (Chur, Graubünden,...). A ridiculous friendly man brought me here from Luzern center (my sign said A14 / Zug). It's right where the highway transforms into a normal road and there is also a bus stop and cars can see you well. I was dropped in Landquart (I wanted to cross the east border to Italy; my sign said "Chur").
Very convenient for cars
There is enough place for people to stop
If you want to go to Livigno through the tunnel, you should check the tunnel opening times online.
I was here in summer when many people/tourists come by. Worked well.
Asked two cars at the gas station and got taken on the highway towards Lausanne. Good spot to get out of Neuchâtel into this direction.
Not many cars but all will be going geneva or lausanne, so high success rate.
Meh, not the best spot, even though the traffic was good, maybe bad luck, but nobody was going to Geneva way. Slept there and in the morning got a ride to another spot inside of Lausanne
For me it was very difficult to get to the spot from the centre of Lausanne, since there were protests and trains were not functional. Once there, however, it was easy to get a ride to Martigny
good spot but be ready i will have to climb up a lot  from train station ^)

Update:The train to take from Gare du Lausanne is S2, not S21. This is a good spot when you're travelling westbound but trickier when as for me travelling eastbound. Still a good spot but further from the Bossieres train stop than you'd like if you carry much luggage. I hitchhiked to the gas station which also worked.
Great spot, a lot of traffic. Easy to go to Lausanne. I got a ride to Estavayer gas station really easy
Good spot at the exit of the stations where cars are slow and you can show them a sign safely. Many Swiss German and German cars here, possible to catch really long rides
2 guys,got a ride in 5min, holding a biiig sign: Bern
Big service station on A1 motorway. It's possible to get a ride to all the main cities in Switzerland from here.
Motorway Service Station, direction Lausanne/Bern/Zurich
People can stop for you at the gas station, direction lucerne.
4 people stop in 15 min all went to Mulhouse the 5th went to Bern. I join him.
traffic gets onto A1 and goes southwards, eastwards or westwards.

banger, i find this one reliable to go far into france direction reims. heading northwest, don't bother taking rides shorter than aire du haut-koenigsbourg. there's plenty of ppl going long distances, especially luxembourg/belgium. also loads of german cars.
Thanks Pia, good to go to Zurich
Lot of cars, lot of possibilities
Quickly got someone to stop driving the A5 up north
Amazing spot. People were asking us where we want to go while we were writing signs. Waited with the signs „Luzern“, „Gotthard“ and „Italy“ for around 40min and got a lift all the way to Como, Italy.
Had a sign A14/Zug.
really good spot to go to the north!

Good Spot to get on the highway towards north/northeast/northwest (Zurich, Basel, Bern). It's a parking-lot situated on the left side of the road. The lane alongside is the one for the highway. Drivers will see you long in advance, can pull over easily (parking-lot) and it is legal to stand there to hitch (a lot of policemen around that area). Got some rides from there already, recommend.

Absolute banger. Directions of Basel/Zürich. You just take your sign, sit on a fence and wait. Tons of space to stop, lots of cars and they are slow because of the traffic light.
Also it is a spectacular view from the bridge if you are going from the bus station (10-15 minutes away btw)
Good spot direction to Zurich. Enough cars and cars goes slowly.
we, 2 males, decided to walk further to the cross road, after the bridge, and we got a local ride quickly. THe aim was to get ride at the last roundabout of the highway to munchen.
good for direction Begenz Lindau...A14
Really nice spot for hitchhiking to Zurich.

Got a ride with some turkish until a gas station (the name of the gas station is "your stop") just after Zürich. They were the second car that stopped after 3 min waiting. People from Kreuzlingen and from Konstanz pass through here.
Roundabout just near the gas station. You can stay on the grass just near the street. Cars can stop at the entrance to the gas station
Good spot, mostly local traffic but easy to go west or north. Use sign, very visible never had any issues, besides the occasional angry tram driver.

There is a space (something like a bus stop bus no bus stopping) for cars to stop just before the Sportweg tram station, cars going not too fast. Got a ride to Bern with a Bern sign in like 45min. It seems to me that it's better here than at the traffic lights, because cars were always arriving when it's green... And you're just in front of the Finanzmuseum...
A lot of slow traffic, still waited 30 min to Basel, but a perfect spot nonetheless

Amazing spot, if you need to get up north definitely go here. We met another hitchhiker who was not so friendly. But five people stopped but did not go to a tactical good location. Next person brought us to freiburg. Amazing

not that great to pull over but good visibility and cars are going slow because of pedestrian crossings
it was raining so we had a bad time but could be rlly rlly good on a better day. as it was we got a lift in 10 minutes but that felt really lucky.
Sunday is slow, during week would be better, multiple directions possible, Zurich, Fribourg, Lausanne, Bienne. Spot is covered from rain and lots of room for stopping.
It was Saturday morning and not much cars, but I just stay there around 20 minutes and got direct car to Thun
this spot is very good for Zürich, Basel but not for Thun/Interlaken (different lane). check https://hitchwiki.org/en/Bern for more informations
A wonderfull spot for hitchiking to Zürich. You can hide under the bridge in case of rain. Got a ride in 5 mins standing just after the bridge.
Took me less than 10 min to find a ride to Zurich on a Saturday afternoon. Decent traffic. Was standing under the bridge.

It was really hot when I was there and the parking lot is in the complete sun. Difficult to get further then Geneva as most cars are Swiss and don’t go further. Eventually I found someone who took me close to Grenoble.
I hate swiss people, we waited so long there, finally French people took us to the border but I don't advise this spot

In the morning asked around the parking lot and managed to get a ride with a spanish family all the way to Montpellier. 

Got stuck here in the evening before so i have great tips for sleeping: 
46.435808, 6.311420 - here is a path to a public beach (you have to walk along the fence) where you can spend the night by the lake :))

46.443501, 6.306302 - if it starts to rain, you can hide under this big public garden tent, there are also super clean public toilets in the back of the building h

To go to geneve super easy. I wanted to skip it because i was going to france and find a ride. There are some trucks, with time you may find a long way. More smiling people than in usuall switzerland roads. Nice place.

Its possible to cross the highway. We wild camped for one night on a field close to the lake of Geneve (no acess to the lake possible cause of rich bitch private properties). At the gas station is a Coop Pronto where you can buy some basic stuff (expensive).
Good spot for hitchhiking both directions, lots of cars stopping!

petrol station closed as of 10/01/2025, but cars still stop for coffee and bathroom. probably a better stop when open (and more patient than me), i was worried by the low traffic and took the first reasonable ride after asking ppl having breakfast in the restaurant.
particularly good for zurich, and a fair amount of german cars
Good spot for a lift to Zurich. I would say any direction is good from here, it's huge gas station with hundreds of cars stopping here.
easy to find lifts towards basel, much harder for lifts anywhere else in switzerland.

This is the first gas station after the Gotthard tunnel.
Everbody here does great distances (Basel for example) and many people rest here.
Not a lot of space to stop but it works. I got a ride to Basel. Recommend to us a sign as it goes direction to Lausanne, Fribourg and Basel.
It seems like a very bad spot, But surprisingly, I got a ride futher closer to Geneva in less than 10 minutes
Doable spot for hitching towards Lausanne and Geneva. Harder if you want to hit Vevey.
Alright spit. Not too much traffic but some people go towards austria
Austrian lady picked me app directly to the Salzburg. Before that I ask only one person. Really really good spot

a good place to get a ride, people see you when they're entering and then leaving the station so they have time to think about it while you're there. Around 70% of the people I asked were going to Zurich and one got me right to the city center.
I always start hitchhiking here. you can get to the gas-station by bus from WIL-mainstation. Stop at Züberwangen-Schulhaus and walk down the path to the highway. Both sides are connected by tunnel.
Helped a Ukrainian man as he didn’t have data and he wanted to get to Germany, so he was happy to take me to Liechtenstein as it was on his way.

I got a ride further towards Vaduz (until Walensee gas station) right after I was dropped ! The first persons I asked took me.
(At gas stations, asking directly is much more efficient than standing with a sign, in my opinion)

2 guys, 12AM weekday

No success in finding ride to Vaduz, we switched to sign "Next gas station" in German and managed to find a ride in 15 minutes.
Average spot in terms of amount of cars, good to move to next, bigger gas stations on A3.
It seemed like a very bad spot, but I managed to catch a direct ride to Geneve in the morning in less than 15 minutes. Cars can see you good from here
I've been waiting just before the entrance for the gas station. Good spot!
With a sign in 15 minutes I got a lift to Geneva. cars go slowly and there is enough space to stop.

there is a small gas-station and a bus-stop, so you can either ask people or hold out your thumb...try to get to the next bigger gasstation on the way to Geneve and there shouldn't be anymore difficulties

2 mins to Basel. 
WARNING ! 
The current spot doesn’t exist anymore, there is a fence before the on-ramp and bumps so cars can’t stop there. 
You can hitchhike BEFORE the traffic lights, not much space to stop but they go very slow and they see you

waited for 30 min with a sign for basel, enough space to pull over with the car. 

just walk and stand before the highway sign and the drivers will se you easy.
Used that spot, waited for 1 hour because of people, else it was a safe place, enough space, slow motion... Use a panel it´s better and more clear for them...

Zurich
Stay before the motorway panel (policemen told me that else I would have to pay)
The configuration is alright, it can be just people behaviours that could change your waiting time
Waited 15 mins and got a ride directly to Bern... Even though there's not much traffic through the petrol station, everyone goes Bern direction

Okay spot, but it's more difficult to catch a ride going to Biel or further down that direction because most people go south towards Bern. You have free public toilets and a restaurant for those with a deeper pocket then mine.

thank you very much for the idea to swim in the river there! if i did not see that before i went hitchhiking i wouldn't have mentioned it i think!

it is a very small gas station, and just before a split toward biel. but i found a ride to the next gas station just before Bern
Gas station Deitingen. Great towards Bern, works also towards Biel. Perfect for a swim in summer! Right behind the gas station.

Good spot, have used it many times.

wait after gas station, you can ask people but sign works fine. To get there take local train to chambésy then walk 5 minutes. Best luck during morning and evening rush hour. Have never waited longer than 1h
Good spot, just ask cars and someone will certainly take on the highway
Quite a good spot to Lausanne. Waited in front of gas station
The first car I asked drove me to Lausanne

Hitchhiked : on my own (girl)
Waiting time: 5min (asked driver)

It was quite a walk from the tram station (Butini), maybe 30min. On the way, there are loads of traffic lights and the road is going straight to the highway. I think there are very good possibilities to get a ride if you have a sign and try from one of the traffic lights. However, the gas station worked very well, I asked a first driver and he drove me past Lausanne. (Was going to Luzern).
Found people who spoke the same language going in the direction of Netherlands, took us through Switzerland to Basel

Good spot to get rides north to Zurich, although many drivers were showing that they were going to the right, idk. Standed with a sign for more than an hour.

A random tip to get to Oberalp pass is to get a ride through the gotthard tunnel, get off in goschenen and then hitchhike your way up through andermatt.
Hard to get a lift to Chur, easy in direction Basel

I stopped here thinking it would be a good place to get a ride north on the A13 on my way to Munich, but after 40mins of people saying they were going on the A2 towards Basel, I gave in and took a ride to 'Gunzgen Nord' to continue east towards Munich on the A1.  This turned out to be a good stradegy (even though a fair detour) as i go a direct lift from there to Munich :)

It took us quite a long time for a ride to Chur. Better option is to go to Zurich from here. But the place is amazing for hitch-hiking as it's crowded with people going north!
Many cars we asked were actually full so have that in mind
Sehr guter spot, trotzdem lange gewartet
There's no place for the cars to stop without hindering traffic. Walk a hundred meters or so up the road to get access to the same cars, but with a pocket they can stop in.

We wanted to go to Basel, Freiburg, Frankfurt, Kassel from there.
Got our first ride over the border very quickly.
Don´t know what I did wrong but I was hitch hiking Aarau direction 3 hours and absolutly nothing...
Waited 10 min. I got picked up by a very friendly African driver. He was going to Bern.
Had no luck and after 45min decided to walk 20min to the next marked spot on hitchmap at the gas station. Worked very well there after asking a few cars

Easy to get a ride towards Lausanne, I recommend taking the first ride to the service station la côte. From there, you can find many cars travelling long distances who stopped there. We tried to get a direct to Bern or Zurich from here, but struggled a lot. Then we wrote Lausanne on our sign and found a driver within 20 to 30 minutes

Ich kam um 15:30 an, fuhr um 16:00 ab. Diese Lage geht.

Great place for direction Solothurn, Basel, Zurich.
Take bus no. 11 to the last station. You can use a short distance ticket for 2,- CHF.

I wouldnt say its a great spot as i waited about an hour there once to get to Zurich. Especially now with the bad roadworks. Sign is absolutely necessary. But the good thing is that there is  much space for cars to stop, cars go slowly too and can see you well. Bus 11 to the Park & Ride.
thumb at the gas station entrance. easy
No real space for cars to stop

Great spot, Even in the rain got a lift to milano

got a ride to Milano in 10 minutes. This station has the perfect size in my opinion. Lot of traffic but small enough to stay in the centre of attention so people kind of have to think about giving you a ride.
to milano
Good spot but difficult for cars to stop - saturday afternoon however wasnt too busy - 1 car every 25 seconds roughly so it meant that they had time to stop without causing traffic
Hard to stop but can confirm that the locals are helpful.
Mostly local traffic and not much space to stop but locals are really helpful.

Mostly cars with swiss license plates, so it can be good to accept a short ride to the next intersection before going towards France. We got lucky and picked up by a french driver. As said in the other comment, many cars and not so much space to pull over, but easily doable

Direction France via the new road 144.

When going East or towards Fribourg or Bern, I usually stay a few meters below the south highway entrance (Dir. Bern), just when the road splits in 3. When hitching West or towards Neuchâtel, I usually stay at the north entrance, as well right when the road splits in 3 again. Usually wait times are around 20-40 minute.
A lot of cars going east so just wait by the pedestrian crossing, where hard shouldder starts. Cars are going slow enough to nitice you and stop on the hard shoulder.

Got here with a young fella. Arrived on a tuesday arround 2:30 pm. We thought it'll get easy because a lot traffice is going through there. While looking for a good spot we saw a car on the side with number plate of Ticion. So we asked the guy and he took us all the way to Bellinzona :D
Many French cars or from Geneva but I got a ride to the big gas station north of Geneva (the guy was going to Vevey) after about 20-30 main. I had a sign for Zürich.

Getting from here to the center of Geneva is quite easy, possibly faster (and cheaper) than the 13 minute train ride. Stand on the separator/sidewalk between the parking and the road, lots of people drive slowly here because of the flow of the traffic. Some drivers will go through the center of Geneva, however all of them will at least leave you at the tram stop (only a few stops to the train station with hardly ever any controls). Great for people who drive through Geneva and don't have the tim
There's no place for the cars to stop without hindering traffic. Walk a hundred meters or so up the road to get access to the same cars, but with a pocket they can stop in.
It used to be very good, now with so many traffic lights and traffic it is a sensless to HH here

TO Bern

You can stand at the bus stop, no problem enough space, and good visibility. 2 lanes!

Fantastic spot, lots of traffic going towards Italy. Got a ride a very long way in 20 minutes. Stand at the traffic circle with a sign just before the gas stations and people can pull into the gas station parking lot to pick you up
Not good place for cars to stop so you must be lucky.
First car took me to Zürich, wasn't that busy though
To go to Bern
Entrance of the highway. Illegal spot but enough space for car to stop. Not that much traffic. Very efficient.

Works towards Wil/St Gallen, although judging from the composition of license plates on passing cars, it would work better for a ride towards Frauenfeld/Lake Constance.
Good spot with space next to lane. Illegal since after highway sign.

Not a lot of space to stop but easy to get closer to Lausanne and 9 highway

Attente très courte, mais arrêt un peu scabreux pour les voitures
Good place for going to Lauterbrunnen or Grindelwald.
good spot for thun and interlaken (dint hitchhike in front of the highway, entrance for this direction)

Also word of advice don’t take rides from a Romanian guy he was kinda creepy. We instead waited a bit longer and got a ride from a train operator headed to work in Basel.

This is a great spot though with room to pull over off the road, cars can be going a bit fast. We got a ride all the way north to the Liechtenstein border. Easy to get to Chur as well.

Waited 3 min to go to Bern from here, no space to stop for cars but worked anyways

Directly in front of the gate for the first parking lot. It took a little, but it worked out really well (obviously also a bit lucky). You can also try to ask at the parkin lots, people offered us rides but not in the needed direction.

Either ask around at the gas stations or stand at the side of the road, excellent visibility and space to pull over. We got to Geneva fairly quickly, probably even easier to go towards France, many french come here for fuel as it is cheaper
Good spot for habkern or beatenberg theres only 2options for the cars

At the bus stop and the train station parking lot

To Mullhouse, to Kolmar, to Strasbourg.  There is a parking lot imedeatly after a boarder - some cars stop there. couldnt get anyone going to st gallen, so had to go around just to get outta here. maybe if we just stood with a sign at the exit it would work better
